revised_title: Exploring Calcium Channels and Fluxes in Plant Cells
tldr: The article discusses the measurement of calcium (Ca2+) fluxes in intact plant cells, focusing on the influx of Ca2+ across the plasma membrane through cation-selective channels. The authors review their recent measurements and explore the mechanisms and control of Ca2+ fluxes, their role in signal transduction, and the impact on cellular activities. They also discuss the challenges and techniques used in measuring these fluxes, including electrophysiological methods and radioisotopic approaches.
